text: Helmholtz stripe effect follows sigmoid transition centered at W:H=0.52
Duty cycle modifier for stripe effects
Comparison baseline reduction: H-stripes vs plain garment reduces effect by 70%
Oppel-Kundt filler curve is non-monotonic: peaks at 8-12 fillers then declines
Luminance additive component: darker garment independently slims
Stripe width: narrow stripes amplify Helmholtz more than wide stripes
Bright horizontal stripes on dark garment maximize perceived widening
Luminance-width relationship follows saturating sigmoid curve
Background luminance multiplier: dark backgrounds amplify slimming 7x
Body-width proportionality correction: wider bodies get smaller % slimming
On white e-commerce background (L*=100), luminance slimming is near zero (0.19%, not significant, p=0.38)
On dark background (L*=30), luminance slimming is meaningful (1.33%, d=1.27, p<0.001)
Red rated as slim as black despite higher L* — hue anomaly
Grey perceived wider than white despite lower L* — hue anomaly
Monochromatic dressing (unbroken vertical column) reduces perceived width by ~1.5-5.0%
Color break at waist splits column, reducing height overestimation by 40-60%
Skin-garment contrast modifier: high contrast sharpens body boundary (+width), low blends (-width)
Luminance contribution to Oppel-Kundt is 20-33% of total effect
Polarity asymmetry: bright-on-dark STRONGER expansion than dark-on-bright
Müller-Lyer effect peaks at ~30 degree fin angle with 15-18% elongation (wings-out)
Wings-OUT (diverging) produces 30-50% stronger effect than wings-IN (converging)
At 90 degrees from body axis, Müller-Lyer effect is zero
Gap between design element and body edge (8-18mm) can REVERSE the illusion
Pattern scale optimal zone: 5-15 repeats across body segment
Single pattern element > 20% of body segment width triggers figure-ground segregation
Diagonal lines decompose into H and V components by angle
Downward chevron creates Müller-Lyer contraction at apex
Attention-to-size conversion factor: 1% fixation shift = 0.3-0.5% perceived size change
Focal point at concern zone produces NEGATIVE score (draws MORE attention)
Loose clothing at waist-hip redirects gaze to legs, producing 1 dress size underestimation
Black clothing directs gaze to upper body; white clothing to waist-hip
Observer awareness suppression: lab data underestimates real-world body scrutiny
Face receives ~20% fixation regardless of clothing; remaining 80% is modulated by garment
HVI magnitude: vertical overestimated 5-10% vs equal horizontal in 2D; 7-13% in 3D
Width vs height asymmetry: height overestimation (7.1%) > width underestimation (4.5%)
Frame orientation modulates HVI: horizontal frame gives 3.9% HVI; vertical frame reduces to ~1%
Color break at widest body point increases perceived zone width by +4-8%
High-contrast color break at waist disrupts vertical continuity, reducing HVI by 40-60%
Garment fit multiplier on L1-L3 illusion effects
Fit as L4 additive: when aligned with L1-3, adds at 0.90x; when conflicting, 50/50 blend
Loose clothing gaze redirection has binary threshold at ~4-8cm ease
Level 1 synergy: luminance + stripe edge component gives 1.44x boost
Level 1 ceiling: 1.01% on light background, scales to 3.03% on dark background
Background multiplier ranges from 0.15 (white) to 6.5 (very dark)
Percentage to score conversion is asymmetric
Color contrast at body transitions: white at waist-hip = double damage
Black at waist-hip = double duty: irradiation contraction + attention redirection away
Confidence SD envelope increases in transition zone
Narrow stripes on wider bodies may preserve Helmholtz deeper into transition zone
Cultural expectations modulate the perceptual effect (Swami 2012 ecological contradiction)
V-neck perceived extension = min(v_depth * 0.55, 2.5) inches for standard V; reduced to v_depth * 0.45 for wrap V (overlap softens effect)
V-neck elongation score = min(perceived_extension / 2.5, 1.0). Capped at 1.0.
V-neck dividing threshold: depth where V transitions from elongating to bust-focal. Shifts by bust size: 7.0in for A-B cup, down to 3.5in for F+ cup.
V-neck bust framing: below dividing threshold = negative (draws eye to bust). Score branches by bust differential and fabric stretch.
Crew neck shortens perceived neck by ~1.0 inch. Creates horizontal line across upper chest.
Boat neck widens perceived shoulders by 1.5-3.0 inches. Width increase proportional to neckline width minus shoulder width.
Boat neck on inverted triangle: score = -0.70 - min(imbalance * 0.04, 0.25). Confidence 0.92 — well-understood bad pairing.
Square neckline angularizes face shape perception. Creates structured frame.
Turtleneck neck shortening: ~2.0 inches for full turtleneck; ~1.2 inches for mock neck.
Turtleneck REVERSAL for long necks: if perceived_neck_after >= 3.0in, neck_score is POSITIVE (0.10 to 0.75 based on original neck length)
Turtleneck collar volume factor: computed as neck_circ/13 * collar_height/3 * fabric_weight_factor. Amplifies upper body volume score.

Turtleneck monolithic column score by body type: apple=-0.35-(collar*0.10); hourglass+large_bust=-0.40-(collar*0.12); inverted_triangle=-0.30-(collar*0.08); plus_size=-0.25-extra_volume-(collar*0.10); rectangle=-0.10; pear=-0.15; default=-0.15-(collar*0.05)
Turtleneck petite amplification: if neck_score < 0, multiply by 1.20 to amplify negative.
Turtleneck tall + long neck (>= 4.5in): neck_score = max(current, 0.65). Ensures tall + long neck gets strong positive.
Sweetheart bust illusion: enhances perceived bust by 0.5-1.0 cup size via curved neckline framing.
Cowl neck adds volume at upper chest. Drape creates visual mass.
Off-shoulder exposure effect depends on shoulder width relative to body. Exposes shoulder-to-arm transition.
Wrap neckline is COMPOUND: 4 weighted components — V-elongation (0.25 weight), diagonal slimming (0.15), waist definition (0.45), bust accommodation (0.15)
Wrap diagonal slimming: base +0.20. Rectangle: +0.25 (creates shape differentiation). Apple: +0.15.
Wrap waist definition — hourglass peak: waist_definition >= 8in -> score 0.70; >= 6in -> 0.55; else 0.40
Wrap waist collapse on apple: WHR > 0.92 -> score -0.35 (tie adds bulk at widest); WHR > 0.88 -> -0.15; WHR > 0.85 -> +0.05; else +0.20
Wrap gaping risk: bust_differential >= 7 AND fabric_friction < 0.3 AND closure='tie' -> gaping_penalty = -0.50
Wrap on rectangle: waist_score = 0.35 (manufactures waist definition)
Wrap on petite + very slim (bust<32, waist<25): waist_score = 0.15, reduced from standard (panels may bunch)
Wrap plus size overlay: bust > 44in AND tie-only closure -> waist_score -= 0.25 (high gaping risk)
Sleeve termination scoring principle: arm appears as wide as where it's last visible. Score maps termination circumference to arm range: 0.0 ratio (narrowest) -> +0.80; 1.0 ratio (widest) -> -0.80.
Sleeve label to length mapping: sleeveless=0, cap=2.5, short=5.0, elbow=10.0, three_quarter=17.0, seven_eighth=19.0, long=23.0 inches from shoulder.
Sleeve danger zone score: -0.65 - (width_ratio - 0.8) * 1.0. Extra penalty for exact danger zone termination.
Sleeve forearm_narrow zone score: +0.75 + (1.0 - width_ratio) * 0.25. Bonus for optimal termination.
Sleeve shoulder_cap zone score: -0.30 - width_ratio * 0.30. Negative because creates 'ledge' effect.
Sleeve wrist zone score: +0.40. Covers everything — neutral-positive.
Plus size sleeve modifier: positive scores *= 1.15 (amplify benefits); negative scores *= 1.25 (amplify negatives, more at stake)
Apple sleeve modifier at danger zone: arm_width_score *= 1.20 (wider danger zone MORE damaging)
Goal 'showcase' + danger_zone + muscular body: REVERSAL — arm_width_score = +0.45 (danger zone frames muscle = positive)
3/4 sleeve translation: on petite arm < 21in, standard 17in reaches WRIST, not forearm. On tall arm > 25in, ends at mid-forearm, 2-3in above optimal.
Puff sleeve widening by volume: fitted=0.5in, slim=1.0in, moderate=2.5in, voluminous=4.0in of shoulder widening.
Puff on inverted triangle: score = -0.70 - min(new_imbalance * 0.04, 0.25). Confidence 0.92. EXTREME REVERSAL — do not recommend.
Puff on pear: correction_pct = widening / shoulder_deficit. Score = 0.50 + correction_pct * 0.40 (range 0.50 to 0.90). Peak use case.
Puff on petite pear: scale_penalty = max(0, (63 - height) / 20) up to 0.30 at 5'0. Neck compression if neck_length < 2.5in: additional -0.30.
Puff on hourglass: if balance_after > 1.5in, creates inverted triangle effect. Score = -0.30 - (balance_after - 1.5) * 0.15. DD+ bust compounds: additional -0.25.
Puff on rectangle: waist_taper_illusion = widening * 0.6. Score = 0.45 + min(taper/4.0, 0.25) (range 0.45 to 0.70).
Puff on petite alone: scale_ratio = widening / height. If > 0.045: score 0.20; > 0.035: 0.35; else 0.50. Neck compression check applies.
Puff on tall: base_score = 0.70 (tall absorbs puff proportionally — elegant).
Puff on apple + plus_size: base_score = 0.25 (combined upper body volume concern). Apple alone: 0.45.
Plus size puff + stiff fabric (drape < 0.3): -0.15 penalty ('armor effect').
Above-knee elongation = min(inches_above * 0.20, 0.60). Diminishing returns — first 3 inches most impactful.
Petite above-knee bonus = (63 - height) / 50. Up to +0.16 at 5'0. Each inch is larger % of total leg.
Tall above-knee diminishment: if leg_ratio > 0.62, elongation *= 0.65 (already-long legs benefit less); else *= 0.85.
Pear thigh exposure penalty: c_thigh > 27in -> -0.35; > 24in -> -0.20; > 22in -> -0.10. If goal='showcase', penalty *= 0.5. If goal='narrower', penalty *= 1.2.
Apple above-knee bonus: slim legs (c_thigh < 22in) -> +0.15; < 24in -> +0.08. Showcases apple's asset (slim legs).
Knee danger zone score: -0.30 base. Petite: -0.40. Bisects leg at joint, creates visual 'cut'.
Safe zone (between knee and calf dangers): sweet spot (25-75% through zone) = +0.30; near edges = +0.15. Tall bonus: +0.10.
Collapsed zone: when safe_zone_size < 0 (petite), score = -0.20. WARNING: no safe below-knee position exists.
Calf danger zone: base -0.35. If calf_prominence > 1.3: -0.50. If > 1.2: -0.42. Petite amplification: *= 1.15.
Calf danger radius = 1.0 + (calf_prominence - 1.0) * 3.0. More prominent calf = wider danger zone.
Below-calf score: +0.15. Past danger zones — shows narrow lower leg.
Ankle on petite: relaxed/oversized/tent silhouette -> -0.15 (volume overwhelms); bodycon/fitted + belt/high waist -> +0.40 (strong elongation); else +0.10.
Ankle on hourglass without belt/waist definition: -0.15 (shape loss from hiding curves in column).
Floor length: tall +0.15; standard +0.05; petite -0.10 (drowning without heels).
Hemline height-scaling: hem_from_shoulder_adjusted = hem_from_shoulder * (body_height / model_height) when height difference > 2 inches.
Waist placement score: improvement = deviation_before - deviation_after from golden ratio (0.618). Score = improvement * 8.0, clamped to [-0.80, +0.80].
Empire + hourglass shape loss: standard fabric -> -0.30 penalty; drapey (drape>0.7) -> -0.15; stretchy (stretch>0.5) -> -0.10.
Empire tent effect: bust_projection * (1.0 - fabric_drape) = tent_severity. If > 2.0: -0.45; > 1.0: -0.25; else -0.10.
Empire + tall + short torso (torso_leg_ratio < 0.35): -0.25 penalty (worsens imbalance).
Drop waist + short legs (leg_ratio < 0.55): -0.30 penalty (dramatically shortens perceived legs). If < 0.58: -0.15.
Natural waist + apple + belt + WHR > 0.88: -0.30 penalty (belt highlights widest circumference). If WHR > 0.85: -0.15.
Short legs (leg_ratio < 0.55) + empire/high waist: +0.10 bonus on top of proportion improvement.
Waist position mapping: empire = height - torso * 0.35; high = height - torso * 0.65; natural = height - torso; drop = height - torso * 1.15.
Dark color slimming: L*<=10: ~4% slim; L*<=25: ~3%; L*<=40: ~2%; L*<=60: ~0.5%; L*<=80: -0.5% (mild widening); L*>80: -1% (widening). Score conversion: slim_pct * 6.25.
Hourglass shape loss in dark: waist_hip_diff >= 8: shape_loss = -0.30 * (1 - L/25); >= 6: -0.20 * factor; else -0.10 * factor. Only applies at L* <= 25.
Rectangle dark bonus: L* <= 25 -> shape_loss = +0.05 (no shape to erase — clean column).
Skin tone contrast modifier: skin_garment_contrast > 0.70 (fair skin + black) -> -0.05 (edges MORE visible); < 0.30 (dark skin + black) -> +0.05 (edges blend).
Horizontal stripe Ashida model by body width percentile: <20th: +0.20 (slim); <30th: +0.12; <50th: +0.03; <70th: -0.05; <85th: -0.12; >=85th: -0.18.
Vertical stripe effect: <30th percentile: -0.08 (may slightly widen — mild Helmholtz inverse); <50th: +0.03; <70th: +0.08; >=70th: +0.12.
Dark stripes bonus: primary_color_lightness < 25 -> dark_bonus = +0.05 (adds to positive, subtracts from negative).
Body width percentile estimation from hip circumference: <36in: 15th; <38: 25th; <40: 40th; <42: 55th; <44: 65th; <46: 75th; <48: 85th; >=48: 92nd.
Master score_garment() calls all sub-scorers and aggregates via compute_dimension_weights() + weighted average of score * weight * confidence.

Dimension weight defaults: neckline/neck_elongation=0.15, neckline/bust_framing=0.12, neckline/torso_slimming=0.08, neckline/upper_body_balance=0.10, sleeves/arm_width=0.15 (or 0.05 if sleeveless), hemline=0.18, waist=0.15, color=0.08, pattern=0.10 (if patterned).
Wrap neckline adds weights: waist_definition=0.20, compound_overall=0.15.

Goal-based weight adjustment: goal='longer neck' -> neck_elongation *= 1.5; bust='enhance/minimize' -> bust_framing *= 1.5; arms='slimmer' -> arm_width *= 1.5; legs='longer' -> hemline *= 1.3; waist='define' -> waist_placement *= 1.5; shoulders='wider/narrower' -> shoulder weights *= 1.4.
Weight normalization: sum to 1.0 after goal adjustment. Clamp: no single weight > 0.35 (prevents single-issue domination). Re-normalize after clamping.
Compound effect diminishing returns: final = sign * (1 - (1-|s1|) * (1-|s2|) * ...)
Neck length calibration: <= 2.0in = very_short (-1.0); 2.5in = short (-0.50); 3.0in = average (0.0); 3.5in = long (+0.50); >= 4.0in = very_long (+1.0).
Shoulder width calibration: <= 13.0in = very_narrow (-1.0); 14.0in = narrow (-0.50); 15.0in = average (0.0); 16.0in = wide (+0.50); >= 17.0in = very_wide (+1.0).
Arm width calibration (upper arm circ): <= 9.0in = slim (-1.0); 10.0in = below_average (-0.50); 11.5in = average (0.0); 13.0in = above_average (+0.50); >= 15.0in = full (+1.0).
Leg length calibration (visual leg as fraction of height): <= 0.52 = very_short (-1.0); 0.55 = short (-0.50); 0.58 = average (0.0); 0.62 = long (+0.50); >= 0.65 = very_long (+1.0).
Waist width calibration (WHR): <= 0.68 = very_defined (-1.0); 0.72 = defined (-0.50); 0.78 = average (0.0); 0.85 = undefined (+0.50); >= 0.90 = very_undefined (+1.0).
Bust size calibration (bust differential): <= 2.0in = very_small (-1.0); 3.5in = small (-0.50); 5.0in = average (0.0); 7.0in = large (+0.50); >= 9.0in = very_large (+1.0).
Height/elongation calibration: <= 60in = very_petite (-1.0); 62in = petite (-0.50); 65in = average (0.0); 68in = tall (+0.50); >= 71in = very_tall (+1.0).
Face shape angularization: jaw_width / cheekbone_width ratio determines angular vs round face score for neckline matching.
Arm circumference profile modeled inch-by-inch from shoulder to wrist. Key landmarks: max upper arm position, forearm narrowest position, elbow at ~44% of arm length.
Anatomical zone mapping: shoulder_cap (0-2in), danger_zone (max_pos±1-1.5), upper_taper, elbow (±1in), forearm_taper, forearm_narrow (±0.5-1.5in), wrist_approach, wrist.
Arm circumference interpolation: between shoulder and widest = increasing; between widest and forearm narrowest = decreasing; between forearm narrowest and wrist = slight increase.
Width ratio computation: (c_at_termination - c_wrist) / (c_upper_arm_max - c_wrist). 0.0 = narrowest visible, 1.0 = widest visible.
Hemline computation engine: inputs are garment_length OR hem_position_label. Adjusts for height difference between model and user.
Danger zone overlap detection for petite: safe_zone_size = knee_danger_bottom - calf_danger_top. If negative, zones collapse.
Knee danger zone: knee_center ± (1.0 below, 1.5 above).
Calf danger radius: 1.0 + (calf_prominence - 1.0) * 3.0. Calf prominence = c_calf_max / c_calf_min.

Worked example: petite pear (5'2, 34-27-40) + wrap dress (3/4 sleeve, 'knee length' from 5'9 model, navy). Overall score: +0.42. Key finding: 'knee length' lands at mid-thigh; 3/4 sleeve reaches wrist.
Worked example translation warnings: (1) 3/4 sleeve hits wrist on 20.5in arm, (2) 'knee length' dress garment_length 39in on 5'9 model = 35in on 5'2 body = 10in above knee.
Same elastane percentage = completely different stretch in woven vs knit. Getting this wrong produces 200-400% errors.
Same GSM, different fiber = different perceived weight/stiffness. Cotton feels 15% heavier than poly; silk 15% lighter.
Sheen score mapped from surface finish type. Interacts with curvature for volume effect. Crushed surfaces reduce curvature mapping to 25%.
Rayon/nylon/elastane double knit (~300gsm, drape 5) is the sweet spot between cling (drape 7+) and projection (drape 3-). Recovery rate ~92%. Built-in smoothing layer.
Standard reference for all scoring. Drape 4, GSM 120-160, Sheen 0.10, Stretch Low, Woven. Sweet spot for rectangle body type.
Drape 6-7, GSM 150-200, Sheen 0.10, Stretch Medium, Knit. Sweet spot for casual wear on lean bodies.
Drape 8, GSM 80-120, Sheen 0.50, Stretch Low, Woven. DANGEROUS: high sheen + high drape + low weight = maximum cling + maximum specular highlighting on curves.
Drape 5-6, GSM 140-200, Sheen 0.15, Stretch Low-Med, Woven. Bridges apple belly. Ponte climate alternative.
Drape 9, GSM 60-80, Sheen 0.55, Stretch Low, Woven. WARNING: High cling risk. Full body contact + high specular highlighting.
Drape 4-5, GSM 200-280, Sheen 0.08, Stretch Low, Woven. Low sheen + moderate weight + moderate drape = safe for professional wear across all body types.
Impact Hierarchy: Fit/Ease 30%, Construction 25%, Fabric behavior 20%, Surface finish 15%, Color 10%. Color is OVERWEIGHTED 5x in popular advice.

All effects scored on -1.0 to +1.0 scale. -1.0 = Maximum volume reduction (compression + dark + matte + structure bridging). 0.00 = Cotton poplin baseline. +1.0 = Maximum volume amplification (cling + shiny + light + projected).
Woven vs Knit Elastane Multiplier: Same elastane percentage = completely different stretch behavior. Getting this wrong produces 200-400% errors in stretch prediction.
Effective GSM (Fiber-Adjusted): Same GSM, different fiber = different perceived weight/stiffness.
The Ponte Advantage: Rayon/nylon/elastane double knit (~300gsm, drape 5) consistently scores as the optimal fabric for bodies with curves.
Apple belly effective front ease: max(0, total_ease - belly_projection x 0.8). Apple belly ALWAYS clings in fluid garments regardless of total ease.

Hourglass Sizing Paradox: Size for bust/hip -> waist has 8-14" EXCESS ease -> boxy silhouette. Size for waist -> bust/hip cling at 45-65% demand -> strain everywhere. No single size fits in non-stretch garments.
Plus Size Compound Cling Effect: Higher circumferences + steeper curvature rates = lower thresholds at ALL zones. Upper arm becomes significant cling zone (14-20" circ).

Hourglass Waist - Structure is WORSE than Cling: Structure at hourglass waist fills the concavity, ERASING the waist definition. Proportion_erosion +0.15-0.25. Moderate cling preserves waist definition better than structure.

Petite in Heavy Fluid Long Garments REVERSAL: 'Avoid heavy fabrics if petite' REVERSES for heavy-but-fluid (drape 7+, gsm 200+) in full-length garments. Heavy fluid in maxi creates unbroken vertical fall lines that ELONGATE.

When surface sheen > 0.15 on a dark garment at a curved zone, the highlight contrast cancels the dark-color benefit. At sheen 0.50: dark benefit fully cancelled (net zero). At sheen 0.75+: dark is actively WORSE than medium-tone matte.

Petite Color Paradox: Dark reduces BOTH width AND height. OPTIMAL: Monochrome in medium tones (lightness 30-60%), creating longest unbroken vertical line. Elongation benefit of monochrome (-0.05 to -0.10 proportion score) is MORE valuable than +/-0.15 width change from dark vs light.
Pear Zone Color Strategy: Light top adds +0.10-0.20 width at narrow shoulders (beneficial). Dark bottom removes -0.15-0.30 at wide hips (beneficial). Combined effect: 2x more effective than all-dark.

12 Independent Body Dimensions: Standard body types capture only 1 of 12 independent dimensions. Two 'pear' bodies with identical bust-waist-hip ratios but different heights, belly projections, and tissue firmness will have completely different experiences.

Scoring Engine Pipeline: Input -> Phase 1 (Fabric Resolution) -> Phase 2 (Body Metric Derivation) -> Phase 3 (Zone Selection) -> Phase 4 (Per-Zone Scoring across 10 principles with diminishing returns) -> Phase 5 (Context Modifiers: sitting, climate) -> Phase 6 (Composite + Recommendation).
MULTIPLIER = 2.25 (revised from 2.75 after Contradiction #10). scale = max(0.75, min(1.20, 1.0 + (62 - user_height)*0.025)). perceived_inches = score * MULTIPLIER * scale.
weighted_sum = sum(score * conf^2). weight_total = sum(conf^2). positive_total = (weighted_sum / weight_total) * 2.5. Capped at 0.70.
remaining = 1.0. For each penalty p (sorted largest first): remaining *= (1.0 - min(0.40, |p|)). sabotage_total = -(1.0 - remaining).

uncertainty_pct = 0.55 - avg_confidence * 0.45. ci_low = perceived_inches * (1 - uncertainty_pct). ci_high = perceived_inches * (1 + uncertainty_pct). At avg_confidence 0.90: +/-15%. At avg_confidence 0.50: +/-40%.

Red in India = purity, bridal, auspicious, fertility. Red in US = passion, danger, romance, boldness. Red at Indian wedding: +0.95 cultural score. Wedding guests avoid red to not overshadow bride: guest wearing red scores -0.30.
White in India = mourning, loss, funerals, widowhood. White in US = purity, weddings (bridal), peace. White at Indian celebration is DEEPLY inappropriate.
Black in India = bad luck, grief, evil eye. Black in US = sophistication, elegance, power. Gaining acceptance for Indian sangeet/reception but still cautious for ceremony.
Gold in India = divine energy, prosperity, sacred. Central to Indian wedding embroidery. Red + gold = ultimate auspicious combo. Gold in US = luxury, glamour, holiday season.
Saffron in India = purity, spiritual discipline, devotion. Worn by holy men. Represents Dharma. Temple associations. Saffron in US = autumn, warmth, Halloween.
US professional: acceptable neckline depth <= 12cm from collarbone. Sleeveless acceptable in many offices.
US formal evening: acceptable neckline depth <= 30cm. Deep necklines, short hemlines standard. Any hemline length acceptable.
India professional: acceptable neckline depth <= 8cm. Hemline below knee. Upper arm coverage common. A well-draped cotton saree carries same authority as Western blazer.
India wedding ceremony: front neckline <= 10cm. Floor/ankle hemline. BACKS can be deep (<= 30cm back ok) - this is traditional.
India wedding reception: front neckline <= 18cm. More relaxed than ceremony. Embellishment expected.

Saree is physics-based draping system (5-9 yards unstitched). Nivi style = vertical pleats (elongation). Bengali style = pallu across front (upper-body volume). Gujarati style = redistributes visual weight to right shoulder. Each must be modeled separately for body perception.
Pallu creates visual proportion division (not hemline). Pallu to waist = ~60/40 split (good). Pallu to mid-thigh = ~50/50 (BAD). Pallu to knee = ~40/60 (good for elongation).
Thick contrasting borders widen at hemline; thin borders create cleaner vertical lines. Border-to-width ratio > 0.15 = significant widening penalty.
A 120 GSM cotton saree with heavy starch behaves like 200+ GSM structured fabric. Model: effective_gsm = gsm x (1 + starch_factor). Starch: none=0, light=0.3, heavy=0.7.
Lehenga waistline sits at hip (delta = -8 to -12cm). Scores 0.30 under standard waistline rules. MUST bypass standard waistline scoring entirely; use choli_length + skirt_flare_angle instead.
Kameez length relative to body creates the proportion division. Longer kameez shortens visual leg line; shorter kameez with churidar elongates it.
Kurti with jeans is the most common outfit for young Indian women. Casual context.
A well-draped cotton saree carries the same authority as a Western blazer in Indian professional context.
Indian formal events (sangeet, reception): heavy embellishment expected. A minimalist garment would underscore.
NEVER use ethnicity as proxy for undertone. South Asian b* ranges 8-35 covering warm, neutral, AND cool. A Tamil woman with b*=12 (neutral) is misserved by 'Indian = warm' assumption.

India is NOT single-climate. Chennai Jan: 24C. Delhi Jan: 7C. Delhi Jun: 42C. Monsoon (Jun-Sep) changes fabric behavior drastically. Temperate zones need month-dependent mode.
Kanjivaram silk in tropical India: comfort = 0.20 but wedding cultural_override = 0.95. Final = 0.80 x cultural + 0.20 x comfort = 0.80. Cultural overrides comfort for ceremonial garments.
Each 2mm fabric layer adds ~0.4cm per side. 3 layers = 2.4cm wider total. CAN change body shape classification (e.g., pear -> rectangle if winter layers add more torso width than hip width).

Women lose ~30% of skin collagen in first 5 years post-menopause (avg onset 51). Model uses step function at 50-55, not smooth curve. A 48yo and 56yo may have dramatically different fabric interactions despite 8 years apart.
Body composition: waist_expansion = (age - 30) x 0.30%/year. At age 50: +6% waist circumference for same weight.
ABSOLUTE RULE: NEVER reference age in user-facing output. NEVER suggest longer sleeves based on age. Score the garment AS CHOSEN; offer fabric alternatives alongside.

HRT, active weightlifting, genetics create 10-15 year variation in tissue compliance. Athletic 55yo may have better tissue than sedentary 35yo. MUST NOT use age alone - use tissue compliance from body scan; age is fallback (confidence = LOW).

India: indirectness_level = 0.75 (US = 0.50). Family shopping mode enabled by default (mothers/daughters share screens; avoid embarrassment). Regional templates in Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Bengali - NOT translated from English (idioms differ).

Indian women have proportionally longer torsos than US women. Hemline fall points differ; midi hits different anatomy.

Critical India data: (1) INDIAsize project (NIFT): 25,000 participants, 6 cities, 3D scanning. (2) Dr. Deepti Gupta (IIT Delhi): bust and hip are critical for Indian garment fit. (3) DRDO surveys: regional breakdown North/South/West. (4) CURES study: central adiposity at lower BMIs than Western.

Garment FIT changes perceived shape by 15-25%. Stripe direction: 4.5-10.7%. Hemline proportion: 5-10%. Luminance: 2-5%. Color alone is WEAKEST lever. Composite enforces: fit_weight (>=0.35) >= sum(all optical illusion weights).

6-step pipeline: curvature factor from radius, crushed sheen reduction, projection depth amplifier (1.0 + projection*0.08), height proportionality (height_modifier), concavity reversal (curvature_factor *= -0.3 for concave zones), dark+shiny compound modifier.

10-step pipeline: garment circumference at zone, apple belly front ease correction (projection*0.8), stretch capacity from total_stretch_pct, stretch demand calculation, base threshold (62-26*rate), modifiers (friction, weight, drape, lining, humidity, projection, height, sleeve), concave zone override, adjusted threshold clamped 5-75, cling score = (demand-threshold)/50, tissue firmness severity modifier (soft 1.3x, firm 0.8x).

Base score from (lightness-50)*0.006. Petite height penalty on dark benefit (height<63: penalty=(63-height)*0.03). Dark+shiny cancellation (lightness<25 and sheen>0.15: cancellation=sheen*2.0). Projection reduces dark benefit (projection>2: proj_reduction=(projection-2)*0.08). Zone-specific proportion scoring for pear (light top helps, dark bottom helps) and inverted triangle (dark top helps, light bottom helps).

9-step pipeline: base air gap from drape (0-31mm), tailoring override (darts + drape<=4: gap*0.35), volume from gap = (gap-6mm)*0.012, height proportionality, curvature interaction (rate>0.7 and drape<=4), apple belly bridging check (capacity=(6-drape)*0.8), proportion erosion at hourglass waist (volume*1.5), heavy-but-fluid elongation bonus (gsm>250 and drape>=7, extra for petite+ankle/floor), rectangle shape-creation bonus.
Texture depth * (1+shadow_multiplier_1.3) * 0.012. Petite texture overwhelm: pattern_scale/torso_front ratio > 0.15 triggers overwhelm_penalty = (ratio-0.094)*2.5.

Vertical stripes: 3D curvature check (projection<1.5: -0.06, 1.5-3: crosses zero ~2.6, >3: +0.03+). Stripe width modifier (<0.25 pinstripe: *0.5, >1.0 wide: *1.5). Petite elongation amplification (*1.5). Horizontal stripes: base +0.07 widening with petite amplifier (*1.3 + 0.10 height reduction), tall-lean benefit (*0.5 - 0.08 height-breaking), pear upper body proportion (-0.12), rectangle shape creation (-0.10). Apple belly attention amplifier (*1.5).

Conformity from drape (9+: -0.60, 7-9: interpolated, 5-7: mild following, 3-5: +0.05-0.25, 1-3: +0.25-0.45). Drape x ease interaction (high drape+loose: barely projects; low drape+loose: strong projection). Waist definition construction bonus (-0.10 toward body-following).

A-line: stiff lightweight failure (drape<=3, gsm<200: +0.08 projects wider), fluid collapse (drape>=8: +0.05 body-con at hip), proper A-line (-0.08 bypasses). Pear amplification (*1.2). Empire: belly bypass (-0.18 to -0.25 for apple), waist proportion loss (-0.15 to -0.20 for hourglass). Wrap: waist definition (+0.15 to +0.18 hourglass), apple gap risk (+0.10 if projection>3 and not faux-wrap). Shift: hourglass waist erasure (-0.20). Peplum: pear hip widening (+0.15), INVT hip addition (+0.18), apple belly bridge (-0.12). Fit-and-flare: waist definition (+0.15 to +0.18 hourglass), hip bypass (-0.08).

Sleeve: cap sleeve arm_circ>15 = +0.15 sausage effect, >13 = +0.08; dolman on petite(<63) = +0.12 overwhelm, on full arm(>14) = -0.10 beneficial; 3/4 sleeve = -0.05 universally flattering. Raglan on INVT = proportion +0.10. Neckline: V-neck bust elongation +0.05-0.08 (petite extra); crew on bust_projection>3 = +0.08 strain; boat on INVT = +0.12 worst, on pear = proportion +0.10 best.

Petite sensitivity: midi = +0.12 maximum shortening + warning, above_knee = -0.08 elongating, ankle = -0.06 clean vertical. Pear mini = +0.10 hits widest thigh + warning. Plus-size mini = +0.12 width emphasis. Universal knee = min(proportion, -0.03) knee is narrow = good.

Reference model: bust 34, waist 25, hip 35, bust_proj 1.5, belly_proj 0.5, hip_proj 1.0, shoulder 16, arm 10, thigh 20. Zone gap map with per-inch coefficients (belly 0.06, bust 0.04+0.008, hip 0.007+0.035, thigh 0.012, arm 0.015). Diverse model reduces gap to 40%. Manipulation discount: base 0.24, tier multipliers (luxury 0.65, premium 0.75, mid 0.85, mass 0.95, fast 1.10).

Hip width estimated as circ*0.35. Curvature rates from differential/vertical_distance. Belly curvature over 6" vertical zone. Curvature radii inverse of rate (min 2-3). Height modifier = 66/actual_height. Body shape classified from differentials and ratios.

10-phase pipeline: resolve fabric, derive body metrics, determine relevant zones (by category, filtered by sleeve type), per-zone scoring across all 9 principles with diminishing returns stacking, photo discount at 0.5 weight, sitting modifier, proportion scoring, attention scoring, goal alignment, zone composite (volume - abs(min(0, proportion))), cross-zone aggregation, hemline scoring, climate check, cling zone severity indicator (3+ zones), goal mismatches, wrap gapping check, transparency check, prediction confidence by body type (rectangle 85% to apple 62%, plus *0.85), final 5-tier recommendation, goal alignment override, warning aggregation, alternative suggestion generation.

Finds worst zone by volume_score. Cling problem -> suggest ponte or lined. Sheen problem (>0.3) -> suggest matte crepe or cotton sateen. Hourglass waist structure problem -> suggest fitted with darts/waist definition. Apple belly problem -> suggest empire waist or A-line from high waist.

Only applies for OFFICE_SEATED context. Sitting deltas: belly = belly_projection*0.04 + 0.05 (apple 4" projection -> +0.21), thigh = 0.08, hip = 0.05, bust = 0.02, waist = 0.03, upper_arm = 0, shoulder = 0.

Three branches: no stripes (0.0), V-stripes only (base -0.05 with rectangle/INVT overrides), H-stripes (base +0.03 + body-size gate + zone-split + stripe width modifier + dark luminance bonus). Zone-split is critical: pear top +0.08 vs bottom -0.05, INVT top -0.12 vs bottom +0.10.

Three color bands: light (L>0.65: expansion penalty), mid (0.25-0.65: proportional), dark (L<0.25: base +0.15). Dark path has body-type multiplier (petite x0.6, tall x1.2, INVT upper x1.4, hourglass x0.7), skin-tone interaction for face-adjacent garments (warm sallow gradient, dark skin low contrast), and sheen override (SI>0.5 inverts dark benefit, amplified x1.5 for apple/plus).

Base gradient: +0.015 per cm above 20cm mid-rise. Petite gate with three paths: short torso (INVERTED to -0.30 if rise>26cm), long torso (x1.5), proportional (x1.3). Tall: x0.5. Apple/Plus muffin-top gate: wide elastic (>=5cm, >=8%) gives +0.10, narrow rigid (<3cm, <5%) OVERRIDES to -0.25. Hourglass high rise bonus +0.03. INVT + high rise + slim leg: x0.6.

Trapezoidal ER response: 0.03-0.06 ramp, 0.06-0.12 peak (+0.25), 0.12-0.18 decline, >0.18 further decline. DRAPE GATE: DC<40% full benefit, 40-65% x0.7, >65% INVERTED to x-0.5 (shelf effect). Body-type: INVT +0.15, tall +0.10, petite+ER>0.12 -0.15, pear +0.05. Plus+stiff: shelf amplified x1.5. Pear hem: mid-thigh -0.10, knee +0.05.

Three zones: semi-fitted (ER 0.03-0.08: +0.15 optimal zone), gap (ER 0.08-0.12: 0.0), tent (ER >= 0.12). Dual-goal split for tent: concealment goal -> +0.25/+0.35, slimming goal -> -0.20/-0.40, balance -> weighted 70% slimming. Five body-type reversals: hourglass -0.20, petite -0.15, plus -0.10, INVT -0.10, tall +0.10, rectangle +0.05.

Three paths: no belt (0.0), tonal belt (-0.03), contrasting belt (base -0.10). Hourglass REVERSAL: +0.20 (wide belt +0.25) — exits early. Petite: penalty x1.5. Apple: -0.25 (spotlights widest). Tall: x0.3. INVT: +0.08. Rectangle: +0.05. Pear: WHR-dependent (+0.05 if narrow, -0.10 if moderate). Plus: belly-zone-dependent (-0.20 if belly concern, +0.05 if not).

Gate: ER > 0.03 = not bodycon (0.0). Fabric construction gate: thin (GSM<200, not structured) vs structured (GSM>=250 or is_structured). Hourglass REVERSAL: thin +0.30, structured +0.35, belly concern -0.15 offset. Apple: athletic +0.20, thin -0.40, structured -0.12. Pear: thin -0.30, structured -0.09. Plus: thin -0.40, structured -0.05. INVT: zone-dependent (-0.15 full, -0.10 top, -0.05 bottom). Rectangle: 0.0.

Four sheen bands: deeply matte (SI<0.15: +0.08), low sheen (0.15-0.35: proportional decline), neutral (0.35-0.50: 0.0), high sheen (>0.50: negative). Body-type multiplier: apple x1.5, plus x1.5, pear hip x1.3, hourglass x0.5 (moderate sheen positive), INVT upper x1.2. CLING TRAP: matte + cling>0.6 OVERRIDES to negative (plus -0.15, apple -0.12, pear -0.10).

Non-V paths: crew (0.0), boat/off-shoulder (INVT -0.15, rectangle +0.08, pear +0.05), scoop (+0.05, INVT +0.08), turtleneck (INVT -0.05, petite short-torso +0.10). V-neck path: base +0.10. INVT +0.18 (max). Hourglass +0.12. Petite short-torso + high rise: CONFLICT -0.05. Petite short-torso + mid/low rise: +0.15. Petite normal: +0.12. Apple: +0.10. Tall: +0.05. Pear: +0.10.

Gate: not monochrome = 0.0. Base +0.08. Dark bonus +0.07. Petite: +0.15 (AMPLIFIED). Tall: +0.03. Hourglass: +0.03 (flattens waist-hip), +belt -> +0.12 (best of both). INVT: +0.05 (misses dark-top-light-bottom). Apple: +0.08, dark +0.15. Pear: +0.05, dark +0.12. Plus: +0.10, plus-dark +0.18 (most reliable combo).

Calls all 10 scorers. Assigns weights: non-applicable -> 0, goal-matching -> x1.5, strong negatives (<-0.15) -> x1.2. Computes weighted average of applicable principles. SILHOUETTE DOMINANCE RULE: if tent/bodycon < -0.20 AND goal = slimming, composite forced to worst_silhouette * 0.3 (cannot go positive). Clamps to [-1, +1].
Same elastane percentage = completely different stretch in woven vs knit. Getting this wrong produces 200-400% errors.
Same GSM, different fiber = different perceived weight/stiffness. Cotton feels 15% heavier than poly; silk 15% lighter.
Sheen score mapped from surface finish type. Interacts with curvature for volume effect. Crushed surfaces reduce curvature mapping to 25%.
Rayon/nylon/elastane double knit (~300gsm, drape 5) is the sweet spot between cling (drape 7+) and projection (drape 3-). Recovery rate ~92%. Built-in smoothing layer.
Standard reference for all scoring. Drape 4, GSM 120-160, Sheen 0.10, Stretch Low, Woven. Sweet spot for rectangle body type.
Drape 6-7, GSM 150-200, Sheen 0.10, Stretch Medium, Knit. Sweet spot for casual wear on lean bodies.
Drape 8, GSM 80-120, Sheen 0.50, Stretch Low, Woven. DANGEROUS: high sheen + high drape + low weight = maximum cling + maximum specular highlighting on curves.
Drape 5-6, GSM 140-200, Sheen 0.15, Stretch Low-Med, Woven. Bridges apple belly. Ponte climate alternative.
Drape 9, GSM 60-80, Sheen 0.55, Stretch Low, Woven. WARNING: High cling risk. Full body contact + high specular highlighting.
Drape 4-5, GSM 200-280, Sheen 0.08, Stretch Low, Woven. Low sheen + moderate weight + moderate drape = safe for professional wear across all body types.

Red in India = purity, bridal, auspicious, fertility. Red in US = passion, danger, romance, boldness. Red at Indian wedding: +0.95 cultural score. Wedding guests avoid red to not overshadow bride: guest wearing red scores -0.30.
White in India = mourning, loss, funerals, widowhood. White in US = purity, weddings (bridal), peace. White at Indian celebration is DEEPLY inappropriate.
Black in India = bad luck, grief, evil eye. Black in US = sophistication, elegance, power. Gaining acceptance for Indian sangeet/reception but still cautious for ceremony.
Gold in India = divine energy, prosperity, sacred. Central to Indian wedding embroidery. Red + gold = ultimate auspicious combo. Gold in US = luxury, glamour, holiday season.
Saffron in India = purity, spiritual discipline, devotion. Worn by holy men. Represents Dharma. Temple associations. Saffron in US = autumn, warmth, Halloween.
US professional: acceptable neckline depth <= 12cm from collarbone. Sleeveless acceptable in many offices.
US formal evening: acceptable neckline depth <= 30cm. Deep necklines, short hemlines standard. Any hemline length acceptable.
India professional: acceptable neckline depth <= 8cm. Hemline below knee. Upper arm coverage common. A well-draped cotton saree carries same authority as Western blazer.
India wedding ceremony: front neckline <= 10cm. Floor/ankle hemline. BACKS can be deep (<= 30cm back ok) - this is traditional.
India wedding reception: front neckline <= 18cm. More relaxed than ceremony. Embellishment expected.

Saree is physics-based draping system (5-9 yards unstitched). Nivi style = vertical pleats (elongation). Bengali style = pallu across front (upper-body volume). Gujarati style = redistributes visual weight to right shoulder. Each must be modeled separately for body perception.
Pallu creates visual proportion division (not hemline). Pallu to waist = ~60/40 split (good). Pallu to mid-thigh = ~50/50 (BAD). Pallu to knee = ~40/60 (good for elongation).
Thick contrasting borders widen at hemline; thin borders create cleaner vertical lines. Border-to-width ratio > 0.15 = significant widening penalty.
A 120 GSM cotton saree with heavy starch behaves like 200+ GSM structured fabric. Model: effective_gsm = gsm x (1 + starch_factor). Starch: none=0, light=0.3, heavy=0.7.
Lehenga waistline sits at hip (delta = -8 to -12cm). Scores 0.30 under standard waistline rules. MUST bypass standard waistline scoring entirely; use choli_length + skirt_flare_angle instead.
Kameez length relative to body creates the proportion division. Longer kameez shortens visual leg line; shorter kameez with churidar elongates it.
Kurti with jeans is the most common outfit for young Indian women. Casual context.
A well-draped cotton saree carries the same authority as a Western blazer in Indian professional context.
Indian formal events (sangeet, reception): heavy embellishment expected. A minimalist garment would underscore.
NEVER use ethnicity as proxy for undertone. South Asian b* ranges 8-35 covering warm, neutral, AND cool. A Tamil woman with b*=12 (neutral) is misserved by 'Indian = warm' assumption.

Cultural override is a MULTIPLIER, not replacement. Cool-toned user in red at Indian wedding still scores lower than warm-toned. When cultural > 0.85 AND undertone < 0.60: trigger shade_recommendation_mode (tomato red vs cherry red vs brick red).
Professional: fit_precision=0.22, fabric_structure=0.18, silhouette=0.15, color_context=0.12, exposure=0.15, trend=0.05, comfort=0.05, embellishment=0.00, cultural_fit=0.08.
Casual: fit=0.08, structure=0.05, silhouette=0.10, color=0.05, exposure=0.03, trend=0.22, comfort=0.32, embellishment=0.08, cultural=0.07.
Formal Evening: fit=0.18, structure=0.15, silhouette=0.20, color=0.08, exposure=0.05, trend=0.12, comfort=0.05, embellishment=0.10, cultural=0.07.
Date Night: fit=0.18, structure=0.10, silhouette=0.22, color=0.10, exposure=0.10, trend=0.12, comfort=0.05, embellishment=0.05, cultural=0.08.
Indian Wedding: fit=0.15, structure=0.15, silhouette=0.15, color=0.20, exposure=0.12, trend=0.05, comfort=0.05, embellishment=0.10, cultural=0.03.
Indian Festival: fit=0.10, structure=0.10, silhouette=0.12, color=0.18, exposure=0.08, trend=0.10, comfort=0.15, embellishment=0.12, cultural=0.05.

Red Dress Effect varies by occasion: Professional = +0.04 net (authority +0.08, risk -0.04). Date night = +0.20 (attractiveness +0.12, confidence +0.08). Indian wedding guest = -0.30 (risks overshadowing bride).
Indian wedding scoring goals: grandeur=0.30, cultural_fit=0.25, color=0.25, modesty=0.20. These REPLACE standard proportion-optimization goals.
Indian casual scoring goals: proportion=0.30, comfort=0.25, color=0.25, trend=0.20.
India is NOT single-climate. Chennai Jan: 24C. Delhi Jan: 7C. Delhi Jun: 42C. Monsoon (Jun-Sep) changes fabric behavior drastically. Temperate zones need month-dependent mode.
Kanjivaram silk in tropical India: comfort = 0.20 but wedding cultural_override = 0.95. Final = 0.80 x cultural + 0.20 x comfort = 0.80. Cultural overrides comfort for ceremonial garments.
Each 2mm fabric layer adds ~0.4cm per side. 3 layers = 2.4cm wider total. CAN change body shape classification (e.g., pear -> rectangle if winter layers add more torso width than hip width).

Women lose ~30% of skin collagen in first 5 years post-menopause (avg onset 51). Model uses step function at 50-55, not smooth curve. A 48yo and 56yo may have dramatically different fabric interactions despite 8 years apart.
Body composition: waist_expansion = (age - 30) x 0.30%/year. At age 50: +6% waist circumference for same weight.
ABSOLUTE RULE: NEVER reference age in user-facing output. NEVER suggest longer sleeves based on age. Score the garment AS CHOSEN; offer fabric alternatives alongside.

HRT, active weightlifting, genetics create 10-15 year variation in tissue compliance. Athletic 55yo may have better tissue than sedentary 35yo. MUST NOT use age alone - use tissue compliance from body scan; age is fallback (confidence = LOW).

India: indirectness_level = 0.75 (US = 0.50). Family shopping mode enabled by default (mothers/daughters share screens; avoid embarrassment). Regional templates in Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Bengali - NOT translated from English (idioms differ).

Body shape categories BANNED from user output: 'apple', 'pear', 'hourglass', 'rectangle', 'inverted triangle'. Replace with specific proportion descriptions: 'Your shoulders are slightly narrower than your hips' (not 'You're a pear').

BANNED: 'flatten/flatter your figure' (use 'complement your proportions'), 'hide/disguise/camouflage' (use 'balance' or 'shift visual focus to [X]'), 'problem area' (use 'area where garment construction matters most'), 'slimming' (use 'streamlined' or 'creates a clean vertical line'), 'you're pear/apple shaped' (use 'based on your shoulder-to-hip ratio'), 'at your age' (NEVER reference age), 'you can't/shouldn't wear' (use 'this works against [your stated goal]'), any reference to 'big' body parts (describe garment's visual EFFECT, never body's SIZE).

Score 0.85-1.00: Enthusiastic ('This [attribute] is going to create [specific positive effect] on you.'). 0.70-0.84: Positive+note ('This works well. For even more [goal], consider [alt].'). 0.50-0.69: Neutral+suggest ('This will [effect]. For [goal], [alt] would [improve].'). 0.30-0.49: Honest redirect ('This [detail] tends to [effect] because [physics]. [Alt] would [goal].'). <0.30: Clear skip+alt ('Skip this one - [physics reason]. [Alt] would [achieve the look].').

US: height 5'3.5" (161cm), weight 171.8lbs (78kg), WHR ~0.83, BMI mean ~29.7, TLR ~0.95-1.00. India: height 5'3" (160cm) urban / 5'0" (152cm) overall, weight 55-65kg urban, WHR ~0.85+, BMI mean ~22-23 but 79% may have excess fat at lower cutoffs. Cannot use BMI as proxy for shape. North taller, South shorter; Punjab 30% obesity, Kerala 28%.
Indian women have proportionally longer torsos than US women. Hemline fall points differ; midi hits different anatomy.

Critical India data: (1) INDIAsize project (NIFT): 25,000 participants, 6 cities, 3D scanning. (2) Dr. Deepti Gupta (IIT Delhi): bust and hip are critical for Indian garment fit. (3) DRDO surveys: regional breakdown North/South/West. (4) CURES study: central adiposity at lower BMIs than Western.

Garment FIT changes perceived shape by 15-25%. Stripe direction: 4.5-10.7%. Hemline proportion: 5-10%. Luminance: 2-5%. Color alone is WEAKEST lever. Composite enforces: fit_weight (>=0.35) >= sum(all optical illusion weights).
